update.description:
Display plugins can’t be run standalone, they need to be loaded into the Displays plugin. As such, this PR gets rid of temporary shortcuts where display plugins were piggybacking on properties of standard GUI plugins in [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/137](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/137):

‌

* DisplayPlugins are now registered as such and not as standard GUI Plugins.
* They are installed in a different directory so they will no longer show in the `Plugins` dropdown menu on MainWindow.
* Before, they were being loaded leveraging `loadPlugin` in Iface, and then casting the loaded gui plugin to a display plugin. Now, the common functionality in `loadPlugin` that is useful for loading both `ignition::gui::Plugin`s and `ignition::gui::DisplayPlugin`s has been factored out into `instantiateCommonPlugin`. `loadPlugin` and `loadDisplayPlugin` wrap `instantiateCommonPlugin` with things specific to their classes: where to look for the plugins before calling `instantiateCommonPlugin`, and how to initialise them afterwards.
* DisplayPlugin doesn’t inherit from Plugin anymore.
update.title: DisplayPlugin loading not piggybacking on standard GUI plugin loading

pull_request.title: DisplayPlugin loading not piggybacking on standard GUI plugin loading

pullrequest.title: DisplayPlugin loading not piggybacking on standard GUI plugin loading

content.raw:
The order matters here, and the pattern followed by common plugins is to look at the plugins which are installed with ign-gui last, so users have many chances to override them.

Also consider adding an `addDisplayPluginPath` function analogous to `addPluginPath`, some downstream projects use this API.
content.html:
The order matters here, and the pattern followed by common plugins is to look at the plugins which are installed with ign-gui last, so users have many chances to override them.

Also consider adding an addDisplayPluginPath function analogous to addPluginPath, some downstream projects use this API.

content.raw:
I'm getting a compile error here:

~~~
/mnt/TERA/code/ign-gui/src/Iface.cc: In function ‘std::shared_ptr<ignition::gui::DisplayPlugin> ignition::gui::loadDisplayPlugin(const string&, const tinyxml2::XMLElement*)’:
/mnt/TERA/code/ign-gui/src/Iface.cc:553:12: error: could not convert ‘false’ from ‘bool’ to ‘std::shared_ptr<ignition::gui::DisplayPlugin>’
     return false;
~~~

Changing to `nullptr` fixes it. I'm using gcc 8.0.1.
content.html:
I'm getting a compile error here:

/mnt/TERA/code/ign-gui/src/Iface.cc: In function ‘std::shared_ptr<ignition::gui::DisplayPlugin> ignition::gui::loadDisplayPlugin(const string&, const tinyxml2::XMLElement*)’:
/mnt/TERA/code/ign-gui/src/Iface.cc:553:12: error: could not convert ‘false’ from ‘bool’ to ‘std::shared_ptr<ignition::gui::DisplayPlugin>’
     return false;

Changing to nullptr fixes it. I'm using gcc 8.0.1.

content.raw:
this PR also adds tests for the plugin loading and checks that display plugins are no longer listed in the list of gui plugins. This is the output of running the loadDisplayConfig tests:

`[ RUN      ] IfaceTest.loadDisplayPlugin`  
`[GUI] [Err] [Iface.cc:98] Application not initialized. Have you called initApp() yet?`  
`[GUI] [Dbg] [Iface.cc:309] Init app`  
`[GUI] [Msg] Applying stylesheet [:/style.qss]`  
`[GUI] [Msg] Loading display plugin [GridDisplay]`  
`[GUI] [Msg] Loading plugin [ignition-rendering0-ogre]`  
`[GUI] [Wrn] [DisplayPlugin.cc:100] Scene "scene" not found, DisplayPlugin plugin won't work.`  
`[GUI] [Dbg] [Iface.cc:329] Stop`  
`[GUI] [Dbg] [Iface.cc:309] Init app`  
`[GUI] [Msg] Applying stylesheet [:/style.qss]`  
`[GUI] [Msg] Loading display plugin [_doesnt_exist]`  
`[GUI] [Err] [Iface.cc:546] Failed to load display plugin [_doesnt_exist] : couldn't find shared library.`  
`[GUI] [Dbg] [Iface.cc:329] Stop`  
`[GUI] [Dbg] [Iface.cc:309] Init app`  
`[GUI] [Msg] Applying stylesheet [:/style.qss]`  
`[GUI] [Msg] Loading display plugin [TestDisplayPlugin]`  
`[GUI] [Wrn] [DisplayPlugin.cc:100] Scene "scene" not found, DisplayPlugin plugin won't work.`  
`[GUI] [Dbg] [Iface.cc:329] Stop`  
`[GUI] [Dbg] [Iface.cc:309] Init app`  
`[GUI] [Msg] Applying stylesheet [:/style.qss]`  
`[GUI] [Msg] Loading display plugin [Publisher]`  
`[GUI] [Err] [Iface.cc:560] Failed to load display plugin [Publisher] : couldn't get interface [ignition::gui::DisplayPlugin].`  
`[GUI] [Dbg] [Iface.cc:329] Stop`  
`[       OK ] IfaceTest.loadDisplayPlugin (266 ms)`
content.html:
this PR also adds tests for the plugin loading and checks that display plugins are no longer listed in the list of gui plugins. This is the output of running the loadDisplayConfig tests:

[ RUN      ] IfaceTest.loadDisplayPlugin
[GUI] [Err] [Iface.cc:98] Application not initialized. Have you called initApp() yet?
[GUI] [Dbg] [Iface.cc:309] Init app
[GUI] [Msg] Applying stylesheet [:/style.qss]
[GUI] [Msg] Loading display plugin [GridDisplay]
[GUI] [Msg] Loading plugin [ignition-rendering0-ogre]
[GUI] [Wrn] [DisplayPlugin.cc:100] Scene "scene" not found, DisplayPlugin plugin won't work.
[GUI] [Dbg] [Iface.cc:329] Stop
[GUI] [Dbg] [Iface.cc:309] Init app
[GUI] [Msg] Applying stylesheet [:/style.qss]
[GUI] [Msg] Loading display plugin [_doesnt_exist]
[GUI] [Err] [Iface.cc:546] Failed to load display plugin [_doesnt_exist] : couldn't find shared library.
[GUI] [Dbg] [Iface.cc:329] Stop
[GUI] [Dbg] [Iface.cc:309] Init app
[GUI] [Msg] Applying stylesheet [:/style.qss]
[GUI] [Msg] Loading display plugin [TestDisplayPlugin]
[GUI] [Wrn] [DisplayPlugin.cc:100] Scene "scene" not found, DisplayPlugin plugin won't work.
[GUI] [Dbg] [Iface.cc:329] Stop
[GUI] [Dbg] [Iface.cc:309] Init app
[GUI] [Msg] Applying stylesheet [:/style.qss]
[GUI] [Msg] Loading display plugin [Publisher]
[GUI] [Err] [Iface.cc:560] Failed to load display plugin [Publisher] : couldn't get interface [ignition::gui::DisplayPlugin].
[GUI] [Dbg] [Iface.cc:329] Stop
[       OK ] IfaceTest.loadDisplayPlugin (266 ms)
